text: Maxwellia lepidota is a species of shrubs or trees in the family Malvaceae. It is endemic to New Caledonia and the only species of the genus Maxwellia. Its closest relatives are all Australian genera in tribe Lasiopetaleae: Guichenotia, Hannafordia, Lysiosepalum, Lasiopetalum and Thomasia.Whitlock, B. A., A. M. Hale, J. L. Indorf, and C. F. Wilkins. (2011) Polyphyly of Rulingia and Commersonia (Lasiopetaleae, Malvaceae S.l.).” Australian Systematic Botany 24 (4-5): 215–25. ==References== Category:Byttnerioideae Category:Endemic flora of New Caledonia Category:Taxa named by Henri Ernest Baillon
title: Maxwellia lepidota
